meaningMnemonic: Using the <kanji>grasp</kanji> meaning of 把 and combining it with <kanji>grip</kanji>, you can tell you're grasping at something and then gripping it. I usually grasp then grip at things flying at me, which makes this word mean <vocabulary>grasp</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>understand</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
